titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sir Thomas Tyrwhitt, Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:58
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Autograph items and copies.
Collection of letters and documents from his papers, chiefly relating to his service to the Prince of Wales, later George IV, king of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fc112 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sir Thomas Tyrwhitt, Papers. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fc112. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

controlaccess.subject: Letters
Nobility -- Great Britain
controlaccess.geogname: Great Britain -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
controlaccess.persname: George, King of Great Britain, IV, 1762-1830
Napoleon, Emperor of the French, I, 1769-1821

did.unittitle: ALS to Sir Nathaniel William Wraxall, 1st bart. (1751-1831)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Downing Street
2 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Robert Banks Jenkinson, 2nd earl of
Liverpool (1770-1828), does not
approve of Wraxall's claim to a
baronetcy.
112/11

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Briers
3 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
On Sir George Cockburn (1763-1847)
and the provisioning of Napoleon I,
emperor of the French (1769-1821),
on St. Helena.
112/22a and b

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Briers
3 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Description of Napoleon I, emperor
of the French (1769-1821), on St.
Helena.
112/23

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Cavendish Square
1 p.; 24 x 18 cm.
Acknowledges that Sir Thomas
Tyrwhitt (1763-1833) did not accept
an offered position.
112/68

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
On the Privy Council.
112/66

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Earlshigh
4 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Sympathy for his illness.
112/73

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Earlshigh
4 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Regrets missing him and discusses
personal matters.
112/72

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Earlshigh
4 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Informing Tyrwhitt of his departure
on the 12th and expresses his regret
at missing Tyrwhitt's impending
visit.
112/74

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Note sent with enclosed music.
112/67

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Mansion House
1 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Demands his support on the Committee
of Orthodox Churchmen.
112/44

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Durham
1 p.; 24 x 18 cm.
Request for his uncle's notes on
Aristophanes.
112/69

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Foreign Office
2 p.; 32 x 19 cm.
Informs Tyrwhitt that he is to be
sent to Paris to attend the
investment in the Order of the
Garter of Louis Philippe, king of
the French (1773-1850).
112/41

did.unittitle: CLANWILLIAM, RICHARD CHRISTIAN MEADE, 3RD EARL OF, 1795-1879

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Foreign Office
2 p.; 32 x 19 cm.
On his being granted passage to and
from Lisbon with Sir Edward Thornton
(1766-1852) by Charles William Vane,
3rd marquis of Londonderry
(1778-1854).
112/38

did.unittitle: CLANWILLIAM, RICHARD CHRISTIAN MEADE, 3RD EARL OF, 1795-1879

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Informs of the government's decision
not to send the Order of the Garter
to John VI, king of Portugal
(1769-1826) as had been originally
planned.
112/39

did.unittitle: CLARENDON, JOHN CHARLES VILLIERS, 3RD EARL OF, 1757-1838

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Walford
4 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Agrees to be named Chairman of the
Rupture Society.
112/79

did.unittitle: Bill to the Prince of Wales, later George IV, king of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 14 p.; 37 x 23 cm. Itemized bill for the sum of £1219.14.5. 112/199

scopecontent.p:
Kensington Palace
4 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Appeal for a position for Sergeant
Rogers.
112/50

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Regents Park
3 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Recommends his servant for
consideration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
St. James Square
2 p.; 24 x 18 cm.
Request for a position for his
servant.
112/52

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
St. James Square
2 p.; 24 x 18 cm.
Thanks him for considering his
servant for a post.
112/53

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Regent's Park
3 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Request for a position for his
servant.
112/55

did.unittitle: DEVON, WILLIAM REGINALD COURTENAY, 11TH EARL OF, 1807-1888

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
House of Lords
2 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Request for a seat for "a very
pleasing and rather good looking
Scotchwoman" at his debate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Grosnor Court
3 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
On Tyrwhitt's illness and his own

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Long's Hotel
3 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Requests his "work upon Turf, coke,

112/83

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Christ Church
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Bill for £10.17.0 in dues from the
butler of Christ Church, Oxford
University.
112/76

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
Request to see him as Tyrwhitt is
about to be struck off the club list.
112/86

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
3 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
Informs him that he has paid
Tyrwhitt's debts at the club.
112/63

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Grove Street
3 p.; 20 x 13 cm.
On the security of his loan.
112/64

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Grove Street
1 p.; 20 x 13 cm.
Indicates his "intention to repay
the money...at the time agreed upon".
112/65

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Plymouth
3 p.; 25 x 20 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
3 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Assures the Prince of Wales that his
petition will be brought before
George III, king of Gt. Brit.
(1738-1820).

did.unittitle: GEORGE IV, KING OF GT. BRIT., 1762-1830
[Memorandum]: draft in the hand of Sir Thomas Tyrwhitt (1763-1833)

scopecontent.p:
Carlton House
4 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Addressed to Henry Addington, 1st
viscount Sidmouth (1757-1844) and
concerns the Prince's debts.
112/6

did.unittitle: GEORGE IV, KING OF GT. BRIT., 1762-1830
[Grant of the Russian order to St. Anne to Sir Thomas Tyrwhitt]: DS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p.; 33 x 19 cm. With the king's seal. 112/40

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Asks if Tyrwhitt will put his
petition before George III, king of
Gt. Brit. (1738-1820).

did.unittitle: GEORGE, PRINCE OF WALES, LATER KING OF GT. BRIT., 1762-1830
2 letters (drafts) in the hand of Sir Thomas Tyrwhitt (1763-1833) to Umdat ul-Umzah, nawab of Arcot and Carnatic, d.1802.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
9 p.; 19 x 11 cm.
Welcomes him to British protection
and presents his sword.
112/18

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Admiralty
1p.; 23 x 19 cm.
He will try to assist the suggested
candidates.
112/46

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p.; 32 x 19 cm. Payment on a loan by Wilhelm, Landgrave of Hesse-Kassel (d.1825) to the Prince of Wales, later George IV, king of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830). 112/35

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
St. Mary's Hall
1 p.; 26 x 21 cm.
On his arrival and first few days at

112/30

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
College of Arms

Introduction to James Pulman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
15 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
On the Royal Household.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
On the health of George III, king of

112/9

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
She is unable to venture forth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Warwick Street

Bill for £5500.

Friendly letter about mutual friends

Henley Hall
3 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Request for a position for a protege.
112/51

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Paris
3 p.; 24 x 18 cm.
Thanks Tyrwhitt for a report sent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Pavilion
1 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Thank-you note.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Carlton House

did.unittitle: LONDONDERRY, CHARLES WILLIAM VANE, 3RD MARQUIS OF, 1778-1854

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Frankfurt
2 p.; 33 x 20 cm.
Encloses copy of a letter from Karl
August Fuerst von Hardenberg
(1750-1822) regarding the arrest of
Mr. Robinson.
112/25

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 20 x 19 cm.
Suggests he speak to Arthur
Wellesley, 1st duke of Wellington
(1769-1852), at Mr. Peel's.
112/43

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Brampton
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Suggests that the Prince Regent,
later George IV, king of Gt. Brit.
(1762-1830), write to Umdat ul-Umzah,
Nawab of Arcot and Carnatic (d.1802).
112/17

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Tunbridge Wells
4 p.; 19 x 12 cm.
Comments on the letter from the
Prince Regent, later George IV, king
of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830), to Umdat
ul-Umzah, Nawab of Arcot and
Carnatic (d.1802).
112/21

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Brompton
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Friendly request for a sum owed.
112/70

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Southampton
4 p.; 25 x 19 cm.
Promises to deliver the letter from
the Prince Regent, later George IV,
king of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830), to
Umdat ul-Umzah, Nawab of Arcot and
Carnatic (d.1802); describes Indian
reactions to European correspondence.
112/20

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[1827 or later] Oct 6
Boom St.
2 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
On his and Tyrwhitt's claim to the
Barony of Scrope.
112/31

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Heralds College
3 p.; 19 x 11 cm.
Denies that Tyrwhitt or Mr. Nevile
has any claim to the Barony of
Scrope.
112/32

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Dyract
2 p.; 19 x 12 cm.
Promises to speak to William Shaw,
1st viscount Cathcart (1755-1843),
about a Captain's promotion.
112/47

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
3 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Congratulations on the grant to the
Prince of Wales, later George IV,
King of Gt. Brit. (1760-1830).
112/7

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Whitehall
1 p.; 32 x 19 cm.
Informs him that the carriage of the

King of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830), will
be allowed in St. James's and
Queen's Parks.
112/37

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Clifford St.
1 p.; 19 x 12 cm.
Invitation to call at the Home
Office.
112/49

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Edinburgh
1 p.; 19 x 11 cm.
Asks what the role of the government

112/75

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Regent St.
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Tells him the expect a decision from

112/45

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Christ Church
2 p.; 19 x 11 cm.
On the death of Phineas Pett; news

112/81

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Advises Tyrwhitt to act upon his own

Gt. Brit. (1760-1830).
112/1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Boxford Rectory
4 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
He failed to procure the Suffolk
"Punch."
112/77

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Boxford Rectory
2 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Has found the "Punch" for which he
was looking.
112/78

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Adderbury
2 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Requests and explanation for his
resignation.
112/87

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Carlton House
3 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
To the Prince of Wales, later George
IV, King of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830);
reports on the Chancellor's assurance
that his petition would be within a
week before the king, George III,
King of Gt. Brit. (1738-1820).
112/5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Carlton House

House of Lords

n.p.

scopecontent.p:
Wilhelmshoehe

apparently accepts Tyrwhitt's

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Wilhelmshoehe
1 p.; 23 x 20 cm.
Identifies his counselor of war as

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Berlin
2 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
The confession of a Mr. Robinson in

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Ramsgate
3 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Claims to be misunderstood, points
out that the Prince Regent, later

(1762-1830), desires him to be made
a baronet.
112/12

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Ramsgate
4 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
On the rejection of his claim to the

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Ramsgate
4 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
Thanks him and explains in detail

112/14

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Ramsgate
4 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
On the infidelity of Caroline Amelia

IV, king of Gt. Brit. (1768-1821).
112/15

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Ramsgate
3 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
What the Prince Regent, later George
IV, king of Gt. Brit. (1762-1830),
should do regarding the infidelity
of his wife, Caroline Amelia
Elizabeth, queen consort of George
IV, (1768-1821).
